topic: How to combine email with typing for production code (Python 3.12+)
prompt: Write a Python 3.12+ focused, accurate explainer for: How to combine email with typing for production code (Python 3.12+)
response_raw:
{
  "title": "Combining Email and Typing in Production-level Python 3.12+ Code",
  "summary": "This explainer demonstrates how to integrate email functionality with the 'typing' module in Python 3.12+ for robust, production-ready code.",

  "key_points": [
    "Utilizing the built-in SMTP library to send emails",
    "Using the 'typing' module for type hinting and improved code readability",
    "Leveraging Python 3.12+ features such as async/await for efficient email sending",
    "Implementing exception handling to ensure error resilience"
  ],

  "code_examples": [
    {
      "language": "python",
      "code": "```\nimport smtplib\nfrom typing import List, Tuple, Dict\n\ndef send_email(to: str, subject: str, body: str) -> None:\n    server = smtplib.SMTP('smtp.example.com', 587)\n    server.starttls()\n    server.login('username@example.com', 'password')\n    message = f'Subject: {subject}\n\n{body}'
           \n    server.sendmail('username@example.com', to, message)\n    server.quit()\n\n# Example usage:\nsend_email(\'recipient@example.com\', 'Greetings!', 'Hello there!\nThis is a test email.')
           \n```"
    }
  ],

  "version_notes": [
    "Python 3.12+'s built-in async/await support can be utilized to improve the efficiency of the send_email function.",
    "The 'typing' module is a standard library available in Python 3.5+."
  ],

  "caveats": [
    "Ensure that the SMTP server configuration (host, port, username, and password) are correctly set for your email service provider.",
    "Proper error handling should be implemented to handle potential issues like network errors or incorrect credentials.",
    "Remember to import necessary libraries when using this code in your projects."
  ]
